frameDefinitions: A Lessor who owns some Goods allows a Lessee to use the Goods temporarily in exchange for Money.
An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal.
An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer.
This frame concerns  words that express an Object's position on a scale, its Measurement, with respect to some attribute, its Dimension.
A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.
frameExamples: She <t>threw</t> her shoes into the dryer .
These works had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region.
The murder of Sergei Kirov <t>set off</t> a chain of events that culminated in the Great Terror of the 1930s.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Lessee</fen> has <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen>.
The <fen>Lessor</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and temporarily exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Lessee</fen>.
The time at which the renting takes place.
The location where the leasing takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the one whose action causes the motion of a <fen>Theme</fen>.  The <fen>Agent</fen> is generally realized as the External Argument.
The role <fen>Theme</fen> is generally an NP Object.
The role <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of motion.
The role <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor <fen>Goal</fen>.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the point at which the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

The role <fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element.
<fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to be set in motion.
A resultant state that the <fen>Theme</fen> is in at the end of its motion.
A previous state that the <fen>Theme</fen> was in before the beginning of its motion.
The time at which the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
The <fen>Agent</fen> acts to influence a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.
The location in which one has influence.
This role identifies the <fen>Dimension</fen> which is measured.  Most LUs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<fen>Object</fen> identifies the item which is measured along one of its <fen>Dimension</fen>s.
<fen>Measurement</fen> identifies the extent of the <fen>Object</fen> along the specified <fen>Dimension</fen>.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Cause</fen> initiates.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen>  when causing to start occurs
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Effect</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: Lee rented a textbook <fex>to Abby</fex>.
Kim rented <fex>the shed</fex> out .
So far, <fex>my company</fex> has rented the video more than three million times .
U-haul rents <fex>almost everywhere</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> threw the china at the wall.
Pat threw <fex>the china</fex> at the wall.
Pat dragged the box <fex>out of the cupboard</fex>.
I pushed the trolley <fex>along the street</fex>.
Kim threw the cat <fex>into the garden</fex>.
Kim pushed the lawnmower <fex>around the garden</fex>.
<fex>The storm</fex> tossed the sailor from the boat
The fireman dragged the injured driver <fex>clear</fex>
Paul pulled Fran upright <fex>from her sitting position</fex>.
We shoved half of the cargo overboard <fex>on the 29th</fex>.
<fex>The wind</fex> made the door rattle.
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.
George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that influenced <fex>Reagan</fex>.
<fex>The balmy temperatures</fex> inspired me to write a poem on the advent of spring.
<fex>The painting</fex> inspired me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.
What factors influenced Nixon <fex>to issue the doctrine</fex>?
Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what influenced him <fex>in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women
Does anyone know what inspired <fex>this song</fex>?
Chavez has much influence <fex>in South America</fex>.
The  new vase is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
<fex>The  new vase</fex> is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
The  new vase is <fex>5 cm</fex> in circumference at the top.
<fex>The programme</fex> sparked a public outcry.
Few things spark <fex>the wrath of the British</fex> like food additives.
<fex>In Obscurania</fex>, the release of the movie sparked protests.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Future of World Religions: Population Growth Projections
The Center for the Study of Global Christianity
